ProgramServiceAccomplishment.DescriptionProgramServiceAccom: COMMUNITY BASED PROGRAMS--BBBS SERVES AT-RISK CHILDREN AGES 6 TO 14, PRIMARILY FROM SINGLE PARENT FEMALE-HEADED HOUSEHOLDS, BY PROVDING STRONG AND ENDURING PROFESSIONALLY SUPPORTED 1 TO 1 RELATIONSHIPS WITH CAREFULLY SCREENED AND TRAINED VOLUNTEERS. VOLUNTEER MENTORS SPEND REGULAR CONSISTENT TIME WITH A CHILD FOR A MINIMUM PERIOD OF ONE YEAR, WITH 80% OF THE MATCHES EXCEEDING THEIR ONE YEAR ANNIVERSARY. THESE RELATIONSHIPS ENCOURAGE CHILDREN TO BUILD HIGHER ASPIRATIONS, GREATER CONFIDENCE, AND STRONGER COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS WHILE PROMOTING EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS AND AVOIDANCE OF RISKY BEHAVIORS; HELPING CHILDREN GROW INTO HAPPY PRODUCTIVE ADULTS. APPROXIMATELY 95 CHILDREN ARE SUPPORTED.

SCHOOL BASED PROGRAMS-- BBBS MATCHES CHILDREN WITH BUSINESS COMMUNITY, HIGH SCHOOL STUDENT, OR COLLEGE STUDENT MENTORS FOR WEEKLY ACTIVITIES HELD ON-SITE AT TWELVE DIFFERENT AREA SCHOOLS. APPROXIMATELY 403 CHILDREN WERE SUPPORTED.

OTHER SITE BASED PROGRAMS - BBBS PARTNERS WITH BOWDOIN COLLEGE, CITY OF BATH POLICE DEPARTMENT AND THE BATH AREA FAMILY YMCA TO PROVIDE MENTORING TO CHILDREN AGES 6-14. APPROXIMATLEY 55 CHILDREN WERE SUPPORTED

A COMMUNITY RESOURCE DEDICATED TO SUPPORTING STABLE AND ENRICHING FRIENDSHIPS BETWEEN CHILDREN AND ADULT MENTORS.

COMMUNITY BASED PROGRAMS--BBBS SERVES AT-RISK CHILDREN AGES 6 TO 14, PRIMARILY FROM SINGLE PARENT FEMALE-HEADED HOUSEHOLDS, BY PROVDING STRONG AND ENDURING PROFESSIONALLY SUPPORTED 1 TO 1 RELATIONSHIPS WITH CAREFULLY SCREENED AND TRAINED VOLUNTEERS. VOLUNTEER MENTORS SPEND REGULAR CONSISTENT TIME WITH A CHILD FOR A MINIMUM PERIOD OF ONE YEAR, WITH 80% OF THE MATCHES EXCEEDING THEIR ONE YEAR ANNIVERSARY. THESE RELATIONSHIPS ENCOURAGE CHILDREN TO BUILD HIGHER ASPIRATIONS, GREATER CONFIDENCE, AND STRONGER COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS WHILE PROMOTING EDUCATIONAL SUCCESS AND AVOIDANCE OF RISKY BEHAVIORS; HELPING CHILDREN GROW INTO HAPPY PRODUCTIVE ADULTS. APPROXIMATELY 95 CHILDREN ARE SUPPORTED.

SCHOOL BASED PROGRAMS-- BBBS MATCHES CHILDREN WITH BUSINESS COMMUNITY, HIGH SCHOOL STUDENT, OR COLLEGE STUDENT MENTORS FOR WEEKLY ACTIVITIES HELD ON-SITE AT TWELVE DIFFERENT AREA SCHOOLS. APPROXIMATELY 403 CHILDREN WERE SUPPORTED.
